cont.entity_a: Sound quality is acceptable for a system at this price. Sound quality and performance are great. Good sound quality but stopped working after a month. Sound quality is fine with okay range.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is average, with the right speaker failing after five months. Sound quality is impressive for the price, with a neutral sound profile. Sound quality is excellent with clear separation of audio elements.

cont.entity_a: Durability is questionable with issues in construction leading to breakage. Headphones quit working after less than a year of light use.
cont.entity_b: Headphones lack longevity, with issues arising after only a few months of use. Durability is poor, with sound cutting out after limited use.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight and comfortable for extended use. Recommended for users needing large ear coverings to accommodate hearing aids.
cont.entity_b: Fit is tight, causing discomfort after extended use. Ear cups become sweaty after extended use.

cont.entity_a: Wireless headphones inherently have noise trade-offs. Static noise occurs when moving head.
cont.entity_b: Noise isolation is disappointing, with inadequate noise attenuation. Audio performance is outstanding with effective noise emulation.

cont.entity_a: Volume control is hard to find. Volume may be low.
Superior product compared to cheaper Sony headphones.
cont.entity_b: The head pad has shrunk over time, making them uncomfortable. The cord is heavy and awkward, affecting usability.

cont.entity_a: Minimal sound leakage makes them suitable for late-night TV listening.
Some issues with missing second battery, which uses a proprietary design.
Clarity and reception are better than Advent brand with occasional static. Reception cuts out when phone rings.
Construction is weak and prone to breakage.
